conbody.p: This section is used for the settings related to ZooKeeper.
The following table describes the parameters of the ZooKeeper section.

row.entry: This is the group name for ZooKeeper.
This parameter defines the confluent kafka RPM package name that is installed in the kafka nodes. Zookeeper comes with kafka.

This parameter describes whether the clog property is enabled or disabled for the zookeeper logs.
The values are true or false.
One of the clog feature provides harmonized logging to make logs more meaningful and easier to use.

entry.p: This is a comma separated list of directories for storing log files.

Ensure that there is sufficient disk space for auxiliary_data_volume where the log files are stored. All VM sizing is done prior to instantiation and there is no re-sizing. Prior to instantiation, see the NCC Performance Engineering Guidelines for dimensioning information and the NCC VNF Artifacts Generator Tool Guide for instructions on how to set an appropriate size.
This is the debug log directory for Zookeeper.

Ensure that there is sufficient disk space for auxiliary_log_volume where the directory is stored. All VM sizing is done prior to instantiation and there is no re-sizing. Prior to instantiation, see the NCC Performance Engineering Guidelines for dimensioning information and the NCC VNF Artifacts Generator Tool Guide for instructions on how to set an appropriate size.
This is the sub-directory for ZooKeeper data under zookeeper_datavolume.

Ensure that there is sufficient disk space for auxiliary_data_volume where the sub-directory is stored. All VM sizing is done prior to instantiation and there is no re-sizing. Prior to instantiation, see the NCC Performance Engineering Guidelines for dimensioning information and the NCC VNF Artifacts Generator Tool Guide for instructions on how to set an appropriate size.
This is the sub-directory for ZooKeeper transaction logs under zookeeper_datavolume.

Ensure that there is sufficient disk space for auxiliary_data_volume where the sub-directory is stored. All VM sizing is done prior to instantiation and there is no re-sizing. Prior to instantiation, see the NCC Performance Engineering Guidelines for dimensioning information and the NCC VNF Artifacts Generator Tool Guide for instructions on how to set an appropriate size.

row.entry: This parameter defines the number of milliseconds of each tick.
This parameter defines the number of ticks that the initial synchronization phase can take.
This parameter defines the number of ticks that can pass between sending a request and getting an acknowledgement.
This parameter defines the port for connecting with clients.
This parameter defines the port for connecting with peers.
This parameter is the election port for ZooKeeper.

entry.p: This parameter defines the maximum number of client connections.
To handle more clients, the value might be increased.
This parameter indicates whether ZooKeeper configuration can be updated by “update configuration” LCM.
The values are true or false.
The values of true and false are case sensitive and must be in lowercase.
This parameter defines whether to back up and recover a log file or not for NCC upgrade and backout.
The values are true or false.
The values of true and false are case sensitive and must be in lowercase.
This parameter defines whether to mount external storage for log files or not.
The values are true or false.
The values of true and false are case sensitive and must be in lowercase.

row.entry: This is a JVM parameter to start ZooKeeper.

This parameter defines the time interval in hours for which the purge task has to be triggered. Setting this parameter to a positive integer (1 and above) enables autopurging. Setting this parameter to 0 disables autopurging.

entry.p: This parameter defines autopurging behavior in ZooKeeper. This parameter defines how many of the most recent snapshots in <zookeeper_data_subdir> and how many of the most recent transaction logs in <zookeeper_datalog_subdir> are retained.
The minimum value is 3.

row.entry: This parameter is used to map label name for Zookeeper volumes when mounting using /dev/disk/by-id/. This should be same as "user_label" for Volume for SMAPP nodes and COMSVC nodes.

entry.p: For details, see VNF Artifacts Generator Tool User Guide, Node Group -> Volume tab and Independent Disk tab section.
NCC does not use this parameter since mounting does not happen for zookeeper volumes happen on Auxiliary nodes.
Allowed values: " "

row.entry:
This parameter is used to store the upgrade flags and backup during upgrades.
Allowed values: /appdata
